words.fact: Acquisition measures how users find your product. This includes all channels like organic search, paid ads, social media, referrals, and direct traffic. Key metrics: traffic sources, cost per acquisition (CPA), and conversion rates from visitor to user.

Activation measures users' first experience and their 'aha moment' - when they realize your product's value. This could be completing a profile, making a first action, or experiencing a core feature. Key metrics: time to value, setup completion rate, and first-action completion.

Retention measures how many users come back and continue using your product over time. This is often the most important metric as it indicates product-market fit. Key metrics: daily/monthly active users (DAU/MAU), churn rate, cohort analysis, and engagement frequency.

Referral measures how many users recommend your product to others, creating viral growth loops. Happy users become advocates who bring in new users. Key metrics: viral coefficient (K-factor), Net Promoter Score (NPS), shares, and invitation acceptance rate.

Revenue measures how you monetize your user base and generate income from your product. This is where you convert users into paying customers. Key metrics: customer lifetime value (LTV), average revenue per user (ARPU), conversion to paid, and LTV:CAC ratio.
